Metadata: Luffolide, a novel anti-​inflammatory terpene from the sponge "Luffariella" sp

Sponges of the genus "Luffariella" have provided a series of sesterterpenes that are potent anti-​inflammatory agents. Both manoalide and seco-manoalide, isolated from the sponge "Luffariella variabilis," are irreversible inhibitors of the enzyme phospholipase A2 (PLA2) while luffariellolide is a partially reversible PLA2 inhibitor that was isolated as a major metabolite of a Palauan species of "Luffariella". The same specimen of "Luffariella" sp. also contained a minor polycyclic sesterterpene, luffolide, that also inhibits hydrolysis of phosphatidylcho​line by bee venom PLA2. That compound is described here.
